javadoc:
A utility class to easily show dialogs that require input from the user.

Option Dialogs


The primary type of dialog provided herein is the basic option dialog that allows the user to specify the buttons that appear on the dialog. By default, the given option text will appear as a button(s), followed by a Cancel button (you can call the {@link #showOptionNoCancelDialog(Component, String, String, String, String, int)} methods if you do not want a Cancel button. To use this type of dialog you can use the various showOptionDialog* methods.

Each of the option dialog methods will return a result, which is a number indicating the choice made by the user. See each method for more details.

Data Input and Choice Dialogs


The methods listed here allow the user to either enter data from the keyboard or to choose from a pre-populated list of data.

{@link #showInputChoiceDialog(Component, String, String, String[], String, int)}
{@link #showInputMultilineDialog(Component, String, String, String)}
{@link #showInputSingleLineDialog(Component, String, String, String)}

Yes/No Dialogs


Finally, there are a series of methods that present Yes and No buttons in a dialog. There are versions that do and do not have a Cancel button.

Basic Message / Warning / Error Dialogs


If you would like to display a simple message to the user, but do not require input from the user, then you should use the various methods of {@link Msg}, such as {@link Msg#showInfo(Object, Component, String, Object)}.

Note, the user will be unable to select any text shown in the message area of the dialog.

"Apply to All" / "Don't Show Again"


For more advanced input dialog usage, to include allowing the user to tell the dialog to remember a particular decision, or to apply a given choice to all future request, see {@link OptionDialogBuilder}.

@see Msg @see OptionDialogBuilder

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Construct a simple informational dialog with a single OK button.

params.name: title
params.comment: The String to be placed in the dialogs title area.

params.name: message
params.comment: The information message to be displayed in the dialog.

params.name: messageType
params.comment:
used to specify a default icon
              
                  ERROR_MESSAGE
                  INFORMATION_MESSAGE
                  WARNING_MESSAGE
                  QUESTION_MESSAGE
                  PLAIN_MESSAGE

params.name: icon
params.comment:
allows the user to specify the icon to be used.
              If non-null, this will override the messageType.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Construct a simple two-option dialog.

params.name: title
params.comment: the String to place in the dialog's title area.

params.name: message
params.comment: the message string explaining the user's option.

params.name: option1
params.comment: The text to place on the first option button.

params.name: option2
params.comment: The text to place on the second option button.

params.name: messageType
params.comment:
used to specify a default icon, can be ERROR_MESSAGE,
	 		INFORMATION_MESSAGE, WARNING_MESSAGE, QUESTION_MESSAGE, or PLAIN_MESSAGE)

params.name: icon
params.comment:
allows the user to specify the icon to be used.  If non-null,
     this will override the messageType.

params.name: addCancel
params.comment: true means add a Cancel button

methods.name: showOptionDialog
methods.comment:
Static helper method to easily display an single-option dialog.  The dialog
 will remain until the user presses the Option1 button or the Cancel button.

params.name: parent
params.comment:
The parent component of this dialog. If the given component is
 a frame or dialog, then the component will be used to parent the option dialog.
 Otherwise, the parent frame or dialog will be found by traversing up the given
 component's parent hierarchy.  Also, null can be used to not parent the dialog at all,
 but this promotes poor dialog behavior

params.name: title
params.comment: The String to be placed in the dialogs title area.

params.name: message
params.comment: The information message to be displayed in the dialog.

params.name: option1
params.comment: The text to place on the option button.

return.comment:
The options selected by the user. 1 if the option button is pressed
  or 0 if the operation is cancelled.

methods.name: showOptionDialogWithCancelAsDefaultButton
methods.comment:
Static helper method to easily display an single-option dialog.  The dialog
 will remain until the user presses the Option1 button or the Cancel button.
 
 The dialog shown by this method will have the cancel button set as the default button so
 that an Enter key press will trigger a cancel action.

params.name: parent
params.comment:
The parent component of this dialog. If the given component is
 a frame or dialog, then the component will be used to parent the option dialog.
 Otherwise, the parent frame or dialog will be found by traversing up the given
 component's parent hierarchy.  Also, null can be used to not parent the dialog at all,
 but this promotes poor dialog behavior

params.comment: The String to be placed in the dialogs title area.

params.name: message
params.comment: The information message to be displayed in the dialog.

params.name: option1
params.comment: The text to place on the option button.

return.comment:
The options selected by the user. 1 if the option button is pressed
  or 0 if the operation is cancelled.

methods.name: showOptionDialog
methods.comment:
Static helper method to easily display an three-option dialog.  The dialog
 will remain until the user presses the Option1, Option2, Option3 or Cancel button.

params.name: parent
params.comment:
The parent component of this dialog. If the given component is
 a frame or dialog, then the component will be used to parent the option dialog.
 Otherwise, the parent frame or dialog will be found by traversing up the given
 component's parent hierarchy.  Also, null can be used.

params.name: title
params.comment: The String to be placed in the dialogs title area.

params.name: message
params.comment: The information message to be displayed in the dialog.

params.name: option1
params.comment: The text to place on the first option button.

params.name: option2
params.comment: The text to place on the second option button.

params.name: option3
params.comment: The text to place on the third option button.

params.name: messageType
params.comment: The type of message to display

return.comment:
The options selected by the user. 1 for the first option and
  2 for the second option and so on.  0 is returned if the operation is cancelled.

methods.name: showYesNoDialog
methods.comment: Dialog with only YES/NO options, no CANCEL

params.name: parent
params.comment: The parent dialog or frame of this dialog. (Can be null)

params.name: title
params.comment: The String to be placed in the dialogs title area.

params.name: message
params.comment: The information message to be displayed in the dialog.

return.comment:
The options selected by the user:
 
                  0 is returned if the operation is cancelled
                  1 for Yes
                  2 for No

methods.javadoc:
Dialog with only YES/NO options, no CANCEL

The dialog shown by this method will have the No button set as the default button so that an Enter key press will trigger a No action. @param parent The parent component of this dialog. If the given component is a frame or dialog, then the component will be used to parent the option dialog. Otherwise, the parent frame or dialog will be found by traversing up the given component's parent hierarchy. Also, null can be used to not parent the dialog at all, but this promotes poor dialog behavior @param title The String to be placed in the dialogs title area. @param message The information message to be displayed in the dialog. @return The options selected by the user: 

                  1 for Yes
                  2 for No

methods.name: showInputSingleLineDialog
methods.comment: Displays a dialog for the user to enter a string value on a single line.

params.name: parent
params.comment: the component to parent this dialog to

params.name: title
params.comment: the title to display on the input dialog

params.name: label
params.comment: the label to display in front of the text field

params.name: initialValue
params.comment: an optional value to set in the text field, can be null

return.comment: the string entered OR null if the dialog was canceled.

methods.name: showInputMultilineDialog
methods.comment: Displays a dialog for the user to enter a multi-line string value.

params.name: parent
params.comment: the component to parent this dialog to

params.name: title
params.comment: the title to display on the input dialog

params.name: label
params.comment: the label to display in front of the text area

params.name: initialValue
params.comment: an optional value that will be set in the text area, can be null

return.comment: the string entered OR null if the dialog was canceled.

methods.name: showInputChoiceDialog
methods.comment:
Displays a dialog for the user to enter a string value by either typing it or
 selecting from a list of possible strings.

params.name: parent
params.comment: the component to parent this dialog to

params.name: title
params.comment: the title to display on the input dialog

params.name: label
params.comment: the label to display in front of the combo box

params.name: selectableValues
params.comment: an array of string to choose from

params.name: initialValue
params.comment:
an optional value to set the combo box to, can be null
 in which the combo box will have the first item from the selectable values.

params.name: messageType
params.comment:
used to specify a default icon, can be ERROR_MESSAGE,
     INFORMATION_MESSAGE, WARNING_MESSAGE, QUESTION_MESSAGE, or PLAIN_MESSAGE)

return.comment: the string entered or chosen OR null if the dialog was canceled.

methods.name: showEditableInputChoiceDialog
methods.comment:
Displays a dialog for the user to enter a string value by either typing it or
 selecting from a list of possible strings.  The list of possible values is editable
 such that the user can enter their own value by typing text.

params.name: parent
params.comment: the component to parent this dialog to

params.name: title
params.comment: the title to display on the input dialog

params.name: label
params.comment: the label to display in front of the combo box

params.name: selectableValues
params.comment: an array of string to choose from

params.name: initialValue
params.comment:
an optional value to set the combo box to, can be null
 in which the combo box will have the first item from the selectable values.

params.name: messageType
params.comment:
used to specify a default icon, can be ERROR_MESSAGE,
     INFORMATION_MESSAGE, WARNING_MESSAGE, QUESTION_MESSAGE, or PLAIN_MESSAGE)

return.comment: the string entered or chosen OR null if the dialog was canceled.

methods.name: getResult

return.comment: selected option; returns CANCEL_OPTION for informational dialogs

methods.javadoc: callback for when the "OK" button is pressed.
methods.name: okCallback
methods.comment: callback for when the "OK" button is pressed.

methods.javadoc: Callback for when the cancel button is pressed.
methods.name: cancelCallback
methods.comment: Callback for when the cancel button is pressed.

methods.name: getIconForMessageType
methods.comment: Returns the Icon to use for the given message type.

params.name: messageType
params.comment: the type of message being displayed.

return.comment: the appropriate Icon.

name: OptionDialog
comment:
A utility class to easily show dialogs that require input from the user.


 Option Dialogs
 
 
 The primary type of
 dialog provided herein is the basic option dialog that allows the user to specify the buttons
 that appear on the dialog.  By default, the given option text will appear as a button(s),
 followed by a Cancel button (you can call the
 #showOptionNoCancelDialog(Component, String, String, String, String, int) methods if
 you do not want a Cancel button.  To use this type of dialog you can use the
 various showOptionDialog* methods.
 
 
 Each of the option dialog methods will return a result, which is a number indicating the
 choice made by the user.  See each method for more details.
 
 


 Data Input and Choice Dialogs
 
 		
 		The methods listed here allow the user to either enter data from the keyboard or to choose
 		from a pre-populated list of data.
 		
 		
 		#showInputChoiceDialog(Component, String, String, String[], String, int)
 		#showInputMultilineDialog(Component, String, String, String)
 		#showInputSingleLineDialog(Component, String, String, String)
 	
 


 Yes/No Dialogs
 
 
 Finally, there are a series of methods that present Yes and No buttons in
 a dialog.  There are versions that do and do not have a Cancel button.
 
 


 Basic Message / Warning / Error Dialogs
 
 
 If you would like to display a simple message to the user, but do not require input from the
 user, then you should use the various methods of Msg, such as
 Msg#showInfo(Object, Component, String, Object).
 
 
 Note, the user will be unable to select any text shown in the message area of the dialog.
 
 
 
 "Apply to All" / "Don't Show Again"
 
 For more advanced input dialog usage, to include allowing the user to tell the dialog
 to remember a particular decision, or to apply a given choice to all future request, see
 OptionDialogBuilder.
